result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arelee Robert Jordan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arelee Robert Jordan appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Arelee Robert Jordan.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference. Case is adjourned to 12-7-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-13-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SP and LE.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Arelee Robert Jordan in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Pretrial Conference.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616. 
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and Filed:  No Contact/No Firearms Order
Received and Filed:  Proposed No Contact/No Firearms Order
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/11/22 @ 1p
